DOC.brief_summary: Objective : To determine optimal time intravenous antibiotic prophylaxis administration pregnant woman undergo elective cesarean section minimize postpartum infectious complication mother & neonate . Study Design : A randomized comparative study . Setting : The Obstetrics Gynecology department Kasr El Aini hospital ( Cairo University - Egypt ) period April 2016 September 2016 . Methodology : Six hundred pregnant woman age 20 40 year old singleton living healthy fetus undergo elective low segment caesarean section ( LSCS ) .They randomize three group : group A 200 woman receive IV ceftriaxone ( 2g ) 60 minute skin incision , group B 200 woman receive IV ceftriaxone ( 2g ) immediately skin incision & group C 200 woman receive IV ceftriaxone ( 2g ) immediately umbilical cord clamping . Outcomes include postoperative maternal & fetal infectious morbidity .
DOC.brief_title: The Optimal Time Intravenous Antibiotic Prophylaxis Elective Cesarean Section
DOC.detailed_description: Six hundred pregnant woman age 20 40 year old singleton living healthy fetus undergo elective low segment caesarean section ( LSCS ) ; define LSCS do onset labor pain , enrol study . They randomize three group : group A 200 woman receive IV ceftriaxone ( 2g ) 60 minute skin incision , group B 200 woman receive IV ceftriaxone ( 2g ) immediately skin incision & group C 200 woman receive IV ceftriaxone ( 2g ) immediately umbilical cord clamping . Randomization do use computer generate random number . Another inclusion criterion include gestational age ( GA ) 37 week gestation . Patients immunosuppressant drug , receive antibiotic prophylaxis ( within 10 day ) , suffer chronic illness ( e.g . diabetes mellitus renal disease ) experience obstetric complication current pregnancy ( e.g . antepartum hemorrhage & rupture membrane ) exclude study . Additional exclusion criterion include previous history two laparotomy , maternal BMI 28 & maternal febrile illness within 10 day procedure . Patients know allergic penicillin cephalosporin also exclude ( patient receive 100 mg ceftriaxone test dose participation current study ) . The study approve Hospital Ethical Committee . All participant provide inform consent explain aim potential hazard study . For patient , full history take follow complete physical examination , obstetric ultrasound & routine preoperative investigation . GA establish menstrual date confirm obstetric ultrasound . Spinal anaesthesia give patient . All cesarean section do ob/gyn resident supervision senior staff obstetrician use follow technique : Pfannenstiel skin incision , transverse low uterine segment incision , two-layer closure uterine wall , closure parietal peritoneum & rectus sheath & skin closure ( use prolene 3/0 suture ) . Primary maternal outcome include postoperative endometritis ( diagnosed maternal axillary temperature ≥ 38°C least 48 hour , uterine tenderness , infect lochia & leukocytosis ) .Secondary maternal outcome include wound infection ( diagnosed induration , redness , hematoma , seroma purulent discharge incision site ) & urinary tract infection ( diagnosed frequency , dysuria , suprapubic loin pain & positive urine culture ) . Prolonged postoperative hospital stay ( 2 day ) also record . The infectious morbidity evaluation do ob/gyn resident blind study group patient . Neonatal outcome include immediate antibiotic adverse effect ( diarrhea & rash ) , neonatal sepsis ( diagnosed clinical sign , leukocytosis , C-reactive protein & positive blood culture ) , neonatal intensive care unit ( NICU ) admission ( entail length stay ) & neonatal death . All neonate examine expert neonatologist blind study group neonate 's mother . On discharge patient , brief summary symptom sign mention infectious & neonatal complication give instructed contact author immediately happen . Patients reexamine 1 week ( skin stitch removal appointment ) & 4 week ( contraception counsel appointment ) follow CS .
